item.title: All Brainrot Gods & How to Get Them in Steal a Brainrot
item.description:
Among all the units in Steal a Brainrot , Brainrot Gods are the most desirable, despite being the second-rarest units in the game. This guide will detail all the Brainrot Gods and how to get them in Steal a Brainrot .

It is not surprising that players want to get these units in their collection. This is because they can generate huge amounts of Cash even without additional multipliers in the form of Traits or Mutations. Moreover, getting them is half the battle, since other players will probably want to steal them.

How to Get Brainrot Gods

Despite their rarity, Brainrot Gods can be obtained in the same way as other units. You can either find these Brainrots on the conveyor belt or steal them from other players . But both of these methods require a special approach.

If you decide to buy a Brainrot God unit, you first need to earn enough Cash. Such Brainrots can cost anywhere from 5-50 million . In addition, you will have to be patient, since the spawn rate of Brainrot Gods in Steal a Brainrot is extremely low. Fortunately, when players reach milestones for likes, a Brainrot God is guaranteed to spawn on the servers.

If you decide to go the cheaper route, it's typically best to attack with a group. Often, players with such rare units carefully guard their base. It's easiest to work as a team to stun the player as soon as their base opens . Then, steal the Brainrot God unit and take it to your base as quickly as possible. After that, you can leave the game or change servers to protect yourself from revenge. But be careful, as other players can use the same strategy against you.

Three units of this rarity can be alternatively obtained through the Brainrot God Lucky Block : Tigroligre Frutonni, Bulbito Bandito Traktorito, and Orcalero Orcala.

All Brainrot Gods in Steal a Brainrot

At the time of writing, there are 23 Brainrot Gods in Steal a Brainrot . Below, you'll find a list of all Brainrot Gods, including their cost and $/s stat.

Brainrot God Cost $/s

Los Orcalitos 45M 235K
Piccione Macchina 40M 225K
Los Tungtungtungcitos 37.5M 210K
Ballerino Lololo 35M 200K
Trippi Troppi Troppa Trippa 30M 175K
Urubini Flamenguini 30M 150K

Trenostruzzo Turbo 3000 25M 150K

Tralalero Tralala 10M 50K

Gattatino Neonino 7.5M 35K
Girafa Celestre 7.5M 20K

item.title: World of Warcraft: Midnight Will Turn More Add-Ons Into Baseline Features
item.description:
World of Warcraft game director Ion Hazzikostas confirmed that the upcoming Midnight expansion will include more features based on popular add-ons, including boss timers, extra nameplate options, and damage meters. The announcement continues a trend that World of Warcraft has been on since Dragonflight, as Blizzard doubles its efforts to have players not depend on add-ons.

During Gamescom Opening Night Live, Blizzard gave players a first look at World of Warcraft: Midnight , the game's 11th expansion. Along with revealing the revamped zones of Quel'thalas and Zul'Aman, which have been around since 2007's The Burning Crusade , Blizzard showed off two new zones called Harandar and the Voidstorm. Alongside the arrival of the Haranir as an allied race for both Alliance and Horde players to pick from, Midnight will also introduce the Devourer specialization for Demon Hunters, which will offer another mid-range DPS option similar to the Devastation Evoker.

World of Warcraft Is Adding More Add-On Functions As Baseline Features

Although Blizzard has made efforts to improve the baseline World of Warcraft user interface, the developers are not done making changes. Hazzikostas and associate game director Paul Kubit hosted a Gamescom panel that focused on the systems and user interface changes planned for the Midnight expansion. Hazzikostas stated that popular add-ons, such as Deadly Boss Mods and Details, will be the basis for the upcoming boss timer and damage meter features. Boss timers will give players an idea of when an attack is coming and tell them where they should stand, while damage meters will give raid leaders a clearer picture of their group's damage output. Hazzikostas also stated that Midnight will bring more nameplate customization options, along with showing what buffs and debuffs are active on a target and which attacks should be interrupted.

Hazzikostas said that the goal of these features for Midnight is to provide players with the information they need during combat without relying on an add-on. Along with the user interface changes planned for Midnight , Hazzikostas stated that Blizzard would also focus on improving the game experience for new and returning World of Warcraft players. Blizzard will also add a mode that gives returning players a way to get their bearings straight. The returning player experience is designed to ease WoW players back into the main gameplay loop without the overwhelming feelings that a full inventory or a long quest log can bring.

Players interested in testing out WoW 's planned features can secure their spots in the upcoming beta by pre-ordering World of Warcraft: Midnight Epic Edition or signing up on Blizzard's website. Though Midnight is slated to launch in 2026, only time will tell when the expansion's core features will be rolled out.

item.title: Pokemon TCG Pocket's Secluded Springs Set Disrespects a 25 Year Old Game
item.description:
As many fans may have predicted after the launch of the Wisdom of Sea and Sky set, Pokemon TCG Pocket is about to release a new expansion based on the Legendary Beasts, titled Secluded Springs. This is a logical next step for Pokemon TCG Pocket , considering the focus on Gen 2 and the Johto region, with Secluded Springs being all about Suicune, Raikou, and Entei, which many fans wanted better cards for after Wisdom of Sea and Sky's regular rares. Secluded Springs does add one Ex variant dedicated to each Legendary Beast, but it doesn't do one old Pokemon game justice with them.

Most older games in the series are doubly beloved by fans because they not only added a plethora of new Pokemon, but they may also have started the whole journey for some players, giving those games an extra layer of nostalgia. This is particularly true for Gen 1, with Kanto Pokemon getting a lot of love in modern games with new regional forms, evolutions, and other variants. Gen 2 is not far behind in terms of nostalgic value for many players, so it may come as a surprise that Pokemon TCG Pocket 's A4a set is "disrespecting" Pokemon Crystal more than it honors its memory.

Pokemon TCG Pocket's Legendary Beasts Are a Mixed Bag

Pokemon TCG Pocket 's next set is coming out in less than a week, on August 28, and its big draw is that it adds Ex cards for Suicune, Raikou, and Entei. However, as the mascot of Pokemon Crystal , Suicune Ex should have arguably gotten much more love than it did, and the same holds true for the other two Beasts. All three Ex variants of the Legendary Beasts share the same ability in the form of Legendary Pulse, which allows players to draw a card at the end of their turn if one of these critters is in the active spot.

However, they all have different attacks with the same Energy cost in Pokemon TCG Pocket . Raikou Ex has Voltaic Bullet, which deals 60 damage and also 10 damage to one benched Pokemon for two Lightning Energy. Entei Ex deals 60 damage with its Blazing Beatdown attack, which can deal up to 120 damage if the Pokemon has two extra Fire Energy, meaning four total. Finally, Suicune Ex has the Crystal Walz attack for two Water Energy, and it deals 20 damage for each benched Pokemon. None of these is game-changing, unfortunately, and with a retreat cost of 2 shared among these cards, they may be tough to play in competitive decks.

It's worth noting that Suicune Ex's attack counts both the user's and the opponent's benched Pokemon.

Pokemon TCG Pocket Suicune Ex Comes With a Big Asterisk Attached

This attack can deal up to 120 damage for just two Energy, which is pretty good, but the condition is that both the user and the opponent have to have their bench full. This is fairly uncommon, as competitive matches call for some moderation in filling the bench, as it may backfire based on the opponent's strategy or cards in their deck, like Pokemon TCG Pocket 's Cyrus, Sabrina, Greninja, etc. Likewise, playing multiple Pokemon cards in a deck thins the odds of getting Suicune Ex and all the other basic cards at once, meaning one may never really reach the ideal point where Crystal Walz deals the maximum amount of damage.

Furthermore, the opponent can also realize what's going on when Pokemon TCG Pocket 's Suicune Ex is played, and decide to avoid placing Pokemon cards on the bench to make Suicune's attack deal less damage than it otherwise would. There are even instances where Suicune Ex's damage may deal 0 damage, or just 20 or 40, which, for two Energy, is quite far from ideal. With just 140 HP, Suicune Ex is fairly squishy for a Pokemon Ex, and it may be hard to justify reserving two spots in a deck for it.

Raikou Ex may be the most playable of the bunch thanks to the faster playstyle of Lightning decks, and if that ends up being the case, it could defeat Suicune Ex in two hits while also damaging the bench. Cards like Zeraora and Tapu Koko Ex could also disrupt Suicune Ex, as well as the "new" Pikachu Ex decks in Pokemon TCG Pocket . This spells bad news for Suicune Ex, unfortunately, given its weakness to Lightning.

Why It's Not All Doom and Gloom For Pokemon TCGP's Suicune Ex

Still, there are some saving graces to Suicune Ex under the right conditions. Some decks like to play as many Pokemon as possible to build their board wide, with a rather relevant example being the current meta Sylveon Ex and Espeon Ex deck in Pokemon TCG Pocket , which benefits from having as many Eevee and Eeveelutions on the bench as possible due to attacking with Espeon Ex and drawing with Sylveon Ex. Against this type of deck, Suicune Ex and, to an extent, Raikou Ex too, can do some real damage - though the opponent can adjust their strategy accordingly.

Interestingly, the Secluded Springs set adds a Mantyke card to the mix, which is another Pokemon TCG Pocket baby Pokemon like those introduced with Wisdom of Sea and Sky, and it ramps Water Energy for Pokemon on the bench. This can make Suicune Ex ready to attack faster, or it can help with a backup plan should Suicune Ex not be good enough in a specific match. Ultimately, it remains to be seen whether the Legendary Beasts will see play in meta decks, but their attacks are not amazing, and Suicune Ex may be disappointing in some games.

item.title: Pokemon Legends: Z-A Could Be Making ‘Pokemon Gun’ a Reality
item.description:
Although two new Mega Evolutions have officially been revealed for Pokemon Legends: Z-A , there are allegedly 24 more left to be revealed if leaks are to be believed. Mega Dragonite and Mega Victreebel are the latest Megas to join the series' roster, growing the number of Gen 1 mons with Meg Evolutions to 15. With only a couple of months left until Pokemon Legends: Z-A 's release, it's unclear how many more Megas will get official reveals, but some recent leaks may have shown the designs for a few rumored mons.

According to an alleged 4Chan leak posted to the PokeLeaks subreddit, the design for Mega Zygarde has been revealed, and it is even more bizarre than Zygarde's other forms. The third member of Kalos' Legendary trio features three forms already, with a fourth on the way if this Mega Evolution leak is real. While the leaked image of Mega Zygarde is hard to interpret, it appears like the mon is taking the form of a missile, harkening back to the "Pokemon Gun" meme that was popularized in Gen 8.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A's Leaked Mega Zygarde Design Channels the 'Pokemon Gun' Meme

The Origins of the 'Pokemon Gun' Meme

When Pokemon Sword and Shield were first announced back in February 2019, the series had yet to feature any DLC or expansions, and a third version or versions were the norm. With a clear emphasis on weapons, given the "Sword" and "Shield" naming conventions, a recurring joke within the Pokemon community was that the third version of the Gen 8 games would be called "Pokemon Gun." Although this version never manifested, and Sword and Shield became the first entries in the Pokemon series to receive DLC rather than an enhanced third version, the meme persisted and became one of the generation's more infamous community jokes.

Most interpretations of the Pokemon Gun meme feature a green gun styled in the same way as Sword and Shield 's logos, and Grookey is often shown holding a gun as well. The Pokemon Company tends to avoid portraying guns in the Pokemon series, so this type of game was never going to happen. However, the meme became so pervasive that some news outlets even mistakenly reported that Pokemon Gun was an official third Gen 8 game.

Early 2024 saw the release of Palworld , often marketed as " Pokemon but with guns," which revitalized the Pokemon Gun meme within the community.

Mega Zygarde Could Be Pokemon Legends: Z-A's Secret Weapon

Pokemon Legends: Z-A has the chance to be the Pokemon Gun version that never was if the leaked design for Mega Zygarde is real. Although Mega Zygarde itself doesn't appear to be a gun, the fact that it looks to be holding a missile is the closest the series has gotten to such a portrayal of weaponry. Pokemon X and Y were some of the darkest games in the series with their Ultimate Weapon storyline and Team Flare Leader Lysandre's plan to eradicate imperfection from the world, so it would be consistent for Pokemon Legends: Z-A to follow a similarly dark storyline.

Perhaps Mega Zygarde is the key to the climax in Pokemon Legends: Z-A , with Lysandre rumored to return as a villain. Allegedly, Lysandre will task the player with finding the various Zygarde Cells around Lumiose City and storing them in the Zygarde Cube. This could culminate in Lysandre attempting to weaponize the Legendary and unleash Mega Zygarde as a replacement for the Ultimate Weapon that was destroyed at the end of Pokemon X and Y 's Team Flare arc. It could also very well be that this leaked Mega Zygarde design is fake, but players will likely need to wait until Legends: Z-A 's release to find out, as it's unlikely the game will officially spoil a major plot point with a reveal like this prior to launch.

item.title: Rumor: The New LEGO Batman Game Has a Bigger Open World Than Arkham Knight
item.description:
LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight will offer players a bigger Gotham City to explore compared to Batman: Arkham Knight , per a new report. Being the latest entry in a long-running series, LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight is the first major LEGO Batman title since 2014's LEGO Batman 3: Beyond Gotham .

In a surprising announcement, Warner Bros Games unveiled a new LEGO Batman game at Gamescom, alongside a humor-filled reveal trailer. Since then, it has sparked a conversation among fans of Batman and LEGO games alike, many of whom are excited about its Batman Arkham -style bits and have positively received its nods to certain highly popular Batman films. As anticipation surrounding the 2026-bound title grows, more details about the project have been surfacing. Additionally, the latest revelation focuses on LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight 's sprawling map.

LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight Reportedly Comes with a Bigger Version of Gotham City than Arkham Knight

The upcoming LEGO Batman game boasts a larger open-world rendition of Gotham City than that present in the highly rated Batman: Arkham Knight , suggests a Twitter account called LEGO Games News. The source states that LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight 's version of the fictional location consists of four different islands, among which the South Island is the biggest one. In other words, the TT Games-developed title features one more island as part of Gotham City compared to Arkham Knight 's three, which include Bleake Island, Founders Island, and Miagani Island. In a reply, the account also shared that the Batmobile, which can help players navigate the game's vast map, plays "similar to Arkham Knight."

Given that Batman: Arkham Knight had the largest rendition of Gotham City in the franchise, the new LEGO Batman game's even bigger take seems exciting. Not only can the addition of an entire new island offer more variety, but it also paves the way for adding more points of interest to the in-game map and potentially a few more characters from the Batman lore to the game's story. Much of that would depend on how TT Games utilizes the extra virtual real estate at its disposal.

LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight is the first non-VR video game, featuring Batman as the protagonist, from Warner Bros Games in over a decade. Taking note of the publisher's recent struggles with layoffs and canceled projects, such as the Wonder Woman game, how the forthcoming LEGO-inspired title performs could prove crucial in the grand scheme of things.
